result.execSummary:
The defendant Kenneth R. Ackerman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Kenneth R. Ackerman is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Kenneth R. Ackerman was found guilty of Possession of Child Pornography, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Counsel stipulate to 0 days credit.  

JOC AMENDED 1/27/17 per directive of Judge Andrew Sharp, in response to DOC's inquiry dated 9/29/16:

"The sentence in this case is consecutive to Iowa County cases 06CF09, 06CF30, 06CF29, 06CF28, 06CF25 and 06CF26" but concurrent with 15CF146/Sauk County case.

Conditions:

Pay costs with additional image surcharge of $500.

Attend, pay for, and successfully complete any educational or training programs required by the agent.

This case is consecutive to 06CF30 but concurrent with Sauk County case 15CF146.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Kenneth R. Ackerman in court, in custody, with attorney Matthew Prior. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Counsel inform the Court the parties have reached an agreement.  Def pleads no contest to Count 1.  Court's colloquy on plea.

Sentence:  8 years prison with 3 years initial confinement and 5 years ext. supervision, consecutive to 06CF30 sentence and concurrent with 15CF146/Sauk Co. case.  Pay costs with additional $500 assessed for one image.  Attend, pay for, and succ. complete any education or training required by e.s. agent.  Firearm admonishments provided.  Credit:  none due per stipulation of counsel.

Remaining counts dismissed.
Order to Transport
Status conference on August 17, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
8/3 status has been moved to 8/17 on reset request from Atty. Piel - no objection from the State
Status conference on August 3, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Status conference on July 13, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Status conference on June 1, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

Attorney Matthew Prior in court for Defendant Kenneth R. Ackerman. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Kenneth R. Ackerman not in court (incarcerated at Stanley Correctional).  Atty. P notes that there's a companion Sauk County case in which motion has been filed; asks that this matter be reset.  Court sets 6/1 at 3:30.  Atty. P asks to appear by phone.  No objection by DA.  Court so allows.  Status conference scheduled for June 1, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
Status conference at 03-30-2016 03:30 pm

Attorney Matthew Prior appeared by phone means for Defendant Kenneth R. Ackerman. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Kenneth R. Ackerman not in court as he is in custody in the state prison system; DA cancelled the transport; notes def is awaiting competency eval in Sauk County matter.  Court adjourned this matter to March 30th at 3:30 p.m.  DA states that State will not do an order to produce unless communication is received stating that def needs to appear.  Status conference scheduled for March 30, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
confirming cancelled transport for arraignment, and changing hearing to status conf. instead of arraignment, and atty requesting to appear via phone - ok'd by judge
Arraignment at 02-26-2016 01:30 pm

Attorney Matthew Prior appeared by phone means for Defendant Kenneth R. Ackerman. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Kenneth R. Ackerman not in court.  DA states that def is incarcerated out of county; was not produced for today's hearing.  Atty. P requests arraignment scheduling; notes that the Court was going to schedule motion hearing and arraignment at same time, however, defense will not be filing the motion and only needs arraignment.  2/26 at 1:30 for arraignment - Atty. P not certain if he will/not file Miranda Goodchild motion.  DA plans to do a writ for 2/26; if something other than that, Atty. P to advise DA.  Arraignment scheduled for February 26, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Status conference at 01-20-2016 01:30 pm
Denying Hearing (clerk phoned defense counsel and dispatch to notify both that Monday's hearing was off and that def should not be transported; Court also notified DA's office)
from DA to the Court - request for ruling on State's responsive brief or adjournment of the 12/14 suppression hearing
State's response to Defense Motion to Suppress
Defendant's Statements
Arraignment at 12-14-2015 03:00 pm

Defendant Kenneth R. Ackerman in court, in custody, with attorney Matthew Prior. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin.  DA calls witness MV.  MV sworn by the clerk and questioned on direct by the DA and then on cross by Atty. Prior.  Bindover ordered.  Arraignment and motion hearing 12/14 at 3.  Defense' motion to be filed by 11/30.  Arraignment scheduled for December 14, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing at 10-16-2015 01:30 pm

Attorney Matthew Prior in court for Defendant Kenneth R. Ackerman. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. DA Harper requests prelim scheduling. No objection by defense. Time limits will continue to be waived. DA is to produce the writ.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Status conference at 09-10-2015 02:00 pm

Defendant Kenneth R. Ackerman not in court (presently incarcerated with DOC). Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Matthew Prior appeared by phone means for Defendant Kenneth R. Ackerman.  Atty. Prior states he and DA have discussed this matter; def has companion case in Sauk County; Atty. P waiting to hear from DA whether there's an agreement with consolidation; additional status requested.  Court sets 9/10 at 2.  Status conference scheduled for September 10, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
Status conference at 08-21-2015 02:00 pm

Attorney Matthew Prior appeared by phone means for Defendant Kenneth R. Ackerman. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin. Atty Prior gives status of this matter, requests setover.  Status conference scheduled for August 21, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
Defendant to submit to booking at the Richland County Sheriff's Department.
Status conference at 07-22-2015 01:30 pm

Defendant Kenneth R. Ackerman in court with attorney Matthew Prior. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Atty. P waives formal reading of the complaint.  Court informs def of the possible max. penalties as well as Def's rights including right to prelim.  Def was summonsed in on this complaint; DA asks for 10k signature bond with booking requirement.  Defense waives prelim time limits.  DA requests status scheduling.  Atty. P joints that request.  Court sets status for July 22 at 1:30.  Atty. P requests telephone appearance.  If Atty. P wants def present, he needs to notify DA for preparation of a writ.  Status conference scheduled for July 22, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Initial appearance at 06-03-2015 01:30 pm
from Atty Prior re. scheduling - granted
